conclusion: Analyze waveforms and vibration images to determine wave direction and speed.
Figure 1 shows waveform with peaks at x = 0 and x = 4 meters.
Wavelength λ = 4 meters from distance between peaks in Figure 1.
Figure 2 shows vibration image with peaks at t = 0 and t = 4 seconds.
Period T = 4 seconds from time between peaks in Figure 2.
Wave speed v is calculated using v = λ/T.
Wave speed v = 1 meter/second using λ = 4 meters and T = 4 seconds.
Direction of wave propagation determined by comparing phase at different points.
At t = 2 seconds in Figure 1, wave is at a certain phase.
At x = 2 meters in Figure 2, particle is at a certain position in vibration cycle.
Direction of wave propagation determined by comparing phase and particle position.
If particle at x = 2 meters moves in same direction as wave, wave moves in positive x-direction.
If particle at x = 2 meters moves in opposite direction, wave moves in negative x-direction.
Wave speed is 1 meter/second, direction determined by phase comparison.
